turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hi!  How are you?  Today, I am working toward getting donations for an international organization called Save the Children.  Are you a parent?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hi, I'm good.  How are you?  I am not a parent.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm really good.  I have three children in high school.  I always wanted more children and I think that is why I am so passionate about Save the Children.  Do you donate to any children's charities?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No, I have never donated to any children's charities. I usually donate to other causes.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Personally, I only donate to two causes.  I donate to a local Down Syndrome Organization and Save the Children.  I have found that many charities are making the organizers rich and the money doesn't always go toward causes I believe in.  Have you heard of Save the Children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I have only heard of Save the Children from doing HITs on mTurk.  Its a commonly referenced charity...so much so that I am convinced its not real lol

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Lol!  I have seen it several times as well, but I assure you, it is real.  Donations to Save the Children ensure children's right to health, education and safety.  I prefer helping people in my own community, however, I feel that Save the Children is so important to children in the USA and other countries.  Today, I am only looking for a small donation.  Would you ever consider donating to an international organization?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, I would consider it

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: To prove that Save the Children is real, I can provide their website if you would like to research it:   URL

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Looks good to me.  Donating would be a nice thing to do

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Sometimes I doubt what I see on mTurk too!  I wanted to assure you the organization is real.  Did you see that half of refugees are children and 77 cents a day can provide shelter for an entire family?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yeah I did.  Its hard to believe that so little can do so much!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: When I saw that, it made me feel terrible.  Just yesterday I spent twice that on a fountain drink at a gas station.  I drank half of it and threw the rest away.  Did you have an amount you were thinking of donating?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yeah its amazing when you think about how much we waste in our day to day lives.  A dollar seems like a good amount to donate.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Like I said, I am only looking for small donations today, so $1 would be fantastic!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Alright great.  A dollar it is!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The research team will collect all donations and send them to Save the Children

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: OK, its just good to know that Save the Children is actually real

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I agree.  I always do mTurk hits as a way to save for a family vacation.  I rarely donate when they ask because I'm never sure they are real or if it's a way for the requester to save money.  Thank you so much for your donation and it was nice chatting with you!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Same here.  These requestors sure can be sneaky.  It was nice chatting with you too!
